labels.analysis: The YNAB Budget Assistant MCP Server is designed to help users manage their finances through artificial intelligence interactions with YNAB (You Need A Budget). It focuses on budget tracking, transaction management, and expense approval. The server's functionality revolves around adding transactions, checking budget summaries, approving expenses, and listing available budgets. The main problem it solves is streamlining financial management through conversational AI.
labels.reasoning: The primary label of "Financial Services" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around managing budgets and financial transactions. Secondary labels of "Daily Productivity" and "Communication Tools" are added because the server helps with personal financial organization and interacts with the user via AI conversations. A custom label is not necessary as the predefined categories adequately cover its functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: YNAB Budget Assistant
server_info_crawled.author: @calebl/ynab-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Interact with your YNAB budget through AI conversations. Manage your finances effortlessly by adding transactions, approving expenses, and checking your budget status with simple commands.

tools.name: budget_summary
tools.description: Deploy Server YNAB Budget Assistant @calebl/ynab-mcp-server Try in Playground budget_summary

tools.name: create_transaction
tools.description: Creates a new transaction in your YNAB budget. Either payee_id or payee_name must be provided in addition to the other required fields.

tools.name: get_unapproved_transactions
tools.description: Gets unapproved transactions from a budget. First time pulls last 3 days, subsequent pulls use server knowledge to get only changes.

tools.name: list_budgets
tools.description: Lists all available budgets from YNAB API

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@calebl/ynab-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
